adjective.description: Extravagantly bright or showy, typically so as to be tasteless.

noun.description: A celebratory reunion dinner or entertainment held by a college.
examples: administratively, the college cannot cope with more than one gaudy per year

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense rejoicing, a celebration): from Latin gaudium joy, or from gaude rejoice!, imperative of gaudere.
